title: Love & Friendship
desc: This is based on the 1871 epistolary novel Lady Susan by Jane Austen.

title: Trucks
desc: This is based on the 1973 short story "Trucks" by Stephen King.

title: Planet of the Apes
desc: This is loosely based on the 1963 French novel La Planète des Singes (known in English as Planet of the Apes in the US and Monkey Planet in the UK) by Pierre Boulle.

title: Horror Story
desc: This is based on the 1999 short story "1408" by Stephen King.

title: The Last Casino
desc: This is based on the 2003 book Bringing Down the House: The Inside Story of Six MIT Students Who Took Vegas for Millions by Ben Mezrich.

title: The Sentinel
desc: This is based on the 2003 novel of the same name by Gerald Petievich.

title: Mirror Mirror
desc: This is based on the 1812 fairy tale "Snow White" collected by the Brothers Grimm.

title: Body Snatchers
desc: This is based on the 1954 novel The Body Snatchers by Jack Finney.

title: The Invisible
desc: This is based on the 2000 novel of the same name by Mats Wahl.

title: Journey to the Center of the Earth
desc: This is loosely based on the 1864 novel of the same name by Jules Verne.

title: The Shaggy Dog
desc: This is based on the 1923 novel The Hound of Florence by Felix Salten.

title: The Taking of Pelham One Two Three
desc: This is based on the 1973 novel of the same name by Morton Freedgood (writing under the pseudonym John Godey).

title: Nancy Drew
desc: This is loosely based on the popular series of mystery novels about the eponymous teen detective, created by Edward Stratemeyer in 1930.

title: The Spiderwick Chronicles
desc: This is based on the book series of the same name by Holly Black and Tony DiTerlizzi, first published in 2003.

title: Legend of the Guardians: The Owls of Ga’Hoole
desc: This is based on the Guardians of Ga'Hoole series by Kathryn Lasky, first published in 2003.

title: Rise of the Guardians
desc: This is based on The Guardians of Childhood series by William Joyce, first published in 2011.

title: Sherlock Holmes
desc: This is based on the literary character of the same name created by Sir Arthur Conan Doyle in 1887.

title: Sherlock Holmes: A Game of Shadows
desc: This is based on the literary character Sherlock Holmes, created by Sir Arthur Conan Doyle in 1887.

title: Young Sherlock Holmes
desc: This is based on the literary character Sherlock Holmes, created by Sir Arthur Conan Doyle in 1887.

title: Winnie the Pooh
desc: This is based on children's literary character of the same name created by A.A. Milne in 1926.

title: The Many Adventures of Winnie the Pooh
desc: This is based on children's literary character of the same name created by A.A. Milne in 1926.

title: Material Girls
desc: This is loosely based on the 1811 novel Sense and Sensibility by Jane Austen.

title: Kit Kittredge: An American Girl
desc: This is based on the Kit Kittredge stories by Valerie Tripp, first published in 1986.

title: Doctor Dolittle
desc: This is loosely based on the series of children's stories of the same name by Hugh Lofting, first published in 1920.

title: The Incredible Journey
desc: This is based on the 1961 novel of the same name by Sheila Burnford.

title: Smooth Talk
desc: This is loosely based on the 1966 short story "Where Are You Going, Where Have You Been?" by Joyce Carol Oates.

title: The Jungle Book
desc: This is based on the 1894 story collection of the same name by Rudyard Kipling.

title: The Jungle Book
desc: This is based on the 1894 story collection of the same name and its 1895 sequel The Second Jungle Book by Rudyard Kipling.

title: The Seventh Sin
desc: This is based on the 1925 novel The Painted Veil by W. Somerset Maugham.

title: The Hunchback of Notre Dame
desc: This is based on the 1831 novel The Hunchback of Notre-Dame by Victor Hugo.

title: The Shopworn Angel
desc: This is based on the 1918 short story "Private Pettigrew's Girl" by Dana Burnet.

title: Pete’s Dragon
desc: This is based on an unpublished short story "Pete's Dragon and the U.S.A. (Forever After)" by Seton I. Miller and S.S. Field.

title: Ben-Hur
desc: This is based on the 1880 novel Ben-Hur: A Tale of the Christ by Lew Wallace.

title: Marie Antoinette
desc: This is based on the 2001 biography Marie Antoinette: The Journey by Antonia Fraser.

title: Death on the Nile
desc: This is based on the 1937 novel of the same name by Agatha Christie.

title: The Musketeer
desc:
This is based on the 1844 novel The Three Musketeers by Alexandre Dumas père.

A list of adaptations can be found here.

title: Death Wish
desc: This is loosely based on the 1972 novel of the same name by Brian Garfield.

title: How to Train Your Dragon 2
desc: This is loosely based on the book series of the same name by Cressida Cowell, first published in 2003.

title: Pet Sematary
desc: This is based on the 1983 novel of the same name by Stephen King.

title: Jumanji: Welcome to the Jungle
desc: This is loosely inspired by the 1981 children's picture book Jumanji by Chris Van Allsburg.

title: Frozen
desc: This is based on the 1844 fairy tale "The Snow Queen" by Hans Christian Andersen.

title: Ithaca
desc: This is based on the 1943 novel The Human Comedy by William Saroyan.

title: The Island of Dr. Moreau
desc: This is based on the 1896 novel The Island of Doctor Moreau by H.G. Wells.

title: Nancy Drew and the Hidden Staircase
desc: This is based on the 1930 book The Hidden Staircase by Carolyn Keene.

title: Nancy Drew and the Hidden Staircase
desc: This is loosely based on the 1930 book The Hidden Staircase by Carolyn Keene.

title: Christopher Robin
desc: This is based on the Winnie-the-Pooh books by A.A. Milne and E.H. Shepard, first published in 1926.

title: The Dirt
desc: This is based on the 2001 collaborative autobiography The Dirt: Confessions of the World's Most Notorious Rock Band by Neil Strauss, Tommy Lee, Mick Mars, Vince Neil, & Nikki Sixx.

title: The Pianist
desc: This is based on the 1946 autobiography The Pianist: The Extraordinary Story of One Man's Survival in Warsaw, 1939–45 by Władysław Szpilman.

title: Dolittle
desc: This is based on the character Doctor Dolittle created in 1920 by Hugh Lofting, primarily the 1922 book The Voyages of Doctor Dolittle.

title: Just Mercy
desc: This is based on the 2014 memoir Just Mercy: A Story of Justice and Redemption by Bryan Stevenson.

title: The Adventures of Ichabod and Mr. Toad
desc: The first segment is based on the 1908 children's novel The Wind in the Willows by Kenneth Grahame and the second segment is based on the 1820 short story "The Legend of Sleepy Hollow" by Washington Irving.

title: The Little Mermaid
desc: This is loosely based on the 1837 Danish fairy tale of the same name by Hans Christian Andersen.

title: Secretary
desc: This is based on the short story of the same name by Mary Gaitskill, which first appeared in his 1988 collection Bad Behavior.

title: They Live
desc: This is based on the 1963 short story "Eight O'Clock in the Morning" by Ray Nelson.

title: A.I. Artificial Intelligence
desc: This is loosely based on the 1969 short story "Supertoys Last All Summer Long" by Brian Aldiss.

title: Border
desc: This is based on the short story of the same name by Ajvide Lindqvist from his 2005 anthology Let the Old Dreams Die.

title: Million Dollar Baby
desc: This is based on short stories by F.X. Toole, the pen name of fight manager and cutman Jerry Boyd, from his 2000 collection Rope Burns: Stories from the Corner.

title: Predestination
desc: This is based on the 1959 short story "—All You Zombies—" by Robert A. Heinlein.

title: Children of the Corn
desc: This is based on the 1977 short story of the same name by Stephen King.

title: The Birds
desc: This is loosely based on the 1952 story of the same name by Daphne du Maurier.
This is based on the 2010 novella of the same name by Stephen King.

title: Doctor Sleep
desc: This is based on the 2013 novel of the same name by Stephen King.

title: Burning
desc: This is based on the 1983 short story "Barn Burning" from The Elephant Vanishes by Haruki Murakami.

title: Rear Window
desc: This is based on the 1942 short story "It Had to Be Murder" by Cornell Woolrich.

title: Mimic
desc: This is based on the short story of the same name by Donald A. Wollheim.

title: Rashomon
desc: This is based on the 1922 short story "In a Grove" by Ryūnosuke Akutagawa.

title: All About Eve
desc: This is based on the 1946 short story "The Wisdom of Eve" by Mary Orr.

title: Re-Animator
desc: This is loosely based on the 1922 serial novelette Herbert West–Reanimator by H.P. Lovecraft.

title: Bicentennial Man
desc: This is based on the 1992 novel The Positronic Man by Isaac Asimov and Robert Silverberg, which is itself based on Asimov's original 1976 novelette "The Bicentennial Man".

title: Don’t Look Now
desc: This is based on the 1971 short story of the same name by Daphne du Maurier, which originally appeared in the collection Not After Midnight, and other stories.

title: The Illusionist
desc: This is loosely based on the 1989 short story "Eisenheim the Illusionist" by Steven Millhauser.

title: Everything Must Go
desc: This is based on the 1981 short story "Why Don't You Dance?" by Raymond Carver.

title: The Night Flier
desc: This is based on the 1988 short story of the same name by Stephen King.

title: Wakefield
desc: This is based on the 2008 short story of the same name by E. L. Doctorow, which was in turn inspired by the 1835 story of the same title by Nathaniel Hawthorne.

title: The Fly
desc: This is based on the 1957 short story of the same name by George Langelaan.

title: Dark Water
desc: This is based on the 1996 short story "Floating Water" by Koji Suzuki.

title: Rollerball
desc: This is based on the 1973 short story "Roller Ball Murder" by William Harrison.

title: The Switch
desc: This is based on the 1996 short story "Baster" by Jeffrey Eugenides.

title: Bubba Ho-tep
desc: This is based on the 1994 novella of the same name by Joe R. Lansdale.

title: Paycheck
desc: This is based on the 1953 short story of the same name by Philip K. Dick.

title: Tale of Tales
desc: This is based on the 1634 collection Pentamerone or Lo cunto de li cunti (Tale of Tales, or Entertainment for Little Ones) by Giambattista Basile.

title: The Lawnmower Man
desc: This is loosely based on the 1975 short story of the same name by Stephen King.

title: Rollerball
desc: This is based on the 1973 short story "Roller Ball Murder" by William Harrison.

title: Johnny Mnemonic
desc: This is based on the 1981 short story of the same name by William Gibson.

title: A Sound of Thunder
desc: This is based on the 1952 short story of the same name by Ray Bradbury.

title: Troy
desc: This is loosely based on the ancient Greek epic poem The Iliad by Homer.

title: Gerald’s Game
desc: This is based on the 1992 novel of the same name by Stephen King.

title: You Were Never Really Here
desc: This is based on the 2013 novella of the same name by Jonathan Ames.

title: The Silence
desc: This is based on the 2015 novel of the same name by Tim Lebbon.

title: The Art of Racing in the Rain
desc: This is based on the 2008 novel of the same name by Garth Stein.

title: The Invisible Man
desc: This is inspired by the 1897 novel of the same name by H.G. Wells.

title: Motherless Brooklyn
desc: This is based on the 1999 novel of the same name by Jonathan Lethem.

title: The Great Mouse Detective
desc: This is based on the 1958 children's book series Basil of Baker Street by Eve Titus, which draws heavily on the character of Sherlock Holmes created by Sir Arthur Conan Doyle.

title: The Human Condition I: No Greater Love
desc: This is based on the six-volume semiautobiographical novel The Human Condition by Junpei Gomikawa, originally published between 1956 and 1958.

title: The Human Condition II: Road to Eternity
desc: This is based on the six-volume semiautobiographical novel The Human Condition by Junpei Gomikawa, originally published between 1956 and 1958.

title: The Human Condition III: A Soldier’s Prayer
desc: This is based on the six-volume semiautobiographical novel The Human Condition by Junpei Gomikawa, originally published between 1956 and 1958.

title: Sleeping Beauty
desc: This is based on the 1697 fairy tale of the same name by Charles Perrault.

title: The Beguiled
desc: This is based on the 1966 novel of the same name by Thomas P. Cullinan (originally published as A Painted Devil).

title: The Beguiled
desc: This is based on the 1966 novel of the same name by Thomas P. Cullinan (originally published as A Painted Devil).

title: Angus, Thongs and Perfect Snogging
desc: This is based on the young adult novels Angus, Thongs and Full-Frontal Snogging (1999) and It's OK, I'm Wearing Really Big Knickers (2001), both by Louise Rennison.
